decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: EX_01, P01(01), P02, P03, & P04(01)

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Removal of PD (Windows/Doors) - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no openings other than those expressly authorised by this permission shall be constructed in the flank walls of the development without planning permission first being obtained from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 5 - No Use of Flat Roof  - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 6 - Tree Protection: The details and measures for the protection of the existing trees as specified in the hereby approved document 'BS 5837:2012 Tree Survey, Arboricultural Impact Assessment, Tree Constraints Plan, Arboricultural Method Statement and Tree Protection Plan'  dated 'November 2024' shall be fully complied with. The methods for the protection of the existing trees shall fully accord with all of the measures specified in the document from the commencement of any site works and until the conclusion of all site works.

Condition : 7 - Hardstanding (Flooding) - The hardstanding hereby permitted shall be made of porous materials, or provision made to direct surface water run-off to a permeable or porous area or surface within the application site before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use.

Condition : 8 - INFORMATIVE (Party Wall Act) - The applicant is advised to check the requirements of the Party Wall Act 1996 relating to work on an existing wall shared with another property, building on the boundary with a neighbouring property, or excavating near a neighbouring building. Further information is available at the following link: 
https://www.gov.uk/party-walls-building-works

Condition : 9 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:
i) The application was acceptable as submitted, and approved [without delay/ with an agreed determination date].
description: ERECTION OF A SINGLE STOREY FRONT EXTENSION AND TWO STOREY SIDE, REAR EXTENSION, OUTBUILDING, AND ERECTION OF BOUNDARY WALL TO FRONT.
